seo_keywords: Shark Rotator TruePet brush not spinning

problems.title: Handle Hose Tear / Hissing Sound
problems.description: Loud air noise near the handle and loss of suction.
possible_causes: Stress crack in the handle hose
solution_steps: Inspect the short hose connecting the handle to the wand.
This is a modular part. You replace the whole handle assembly.
Duct tape only works for a few days.

problems.title: Brush Roll Light is Red
problems.description: Floor nozzle lights are red and brush isn't turning.
solution_steps: Check the small hose at the bottom of the floor nozzle.
If it's split, you can buy a repair hose instead of a whole new head.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a Rotator Powered Lift-Away TruePet (NV752)?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $486 vacuum, and extending the life of your Shark is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Rotator Powered Lift-Away TruePet (NV752) needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include reduced performance and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my Rotator Powered Lift-Away TruePet (NV752) myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
